qas.question: May Welsh clubs enter the competition?

answers.text: Welsh sides that play in English leagues are eligible,

qas.question: Has a Welsh team ever won a competition?

answers.text: Cardiff City (the only non-English team to win the tournament, in 1927)

qas.question: Have any other countries ever competed?

answers.text: other teams from Wales, Ireland and Scotland also took part in the competition,
barred from entering by the Scottish Football Association.

qas.question: Has any other  country been allowed to enter the competition since?

answers.text: Channel Island club entered the competition when Guernsey F.C. competed for the first time.

qas.question: When was the League of Wales created?
What Welsh team has lost a tournament?
Which countries have never had a team compete?
What year were teams from Scotland, Wales, and Ireland barred from entering?
What season did the Channel Island club play for the last time?

context: <a0_0>Welsh sides that play in English leagues are eligible,<a0_0/> although since the creation of the League of Wales there are only six clubs remaining: <a1_0><b6_0>Cardiff City<b6_0/> (the only non-English team to win the tournament, in <b5_0>1927<b5_0/>)<a1_0/>, Swansea City, Newport County, Wrexham, Merthyr Town and Colwyn Bay. In the early years <a2_0>other teams from <b7_0>Wales, Ireland and Scotland<b7_0/> also took part in the competition,<a2_0/> with Glasgow side Queen's Park losing the final to Blackburn Rovers in 1884 and <b8_0>1885<b8_0/> before being <a3_0>barred from entering by the Scottish Football Association.<a3_0/> In the <b9_0>2013–14<b9_0/> season the first <a4_0>Channel Island club entered the competition when Guernsey F.C. competed for the first time.
